This app is great when it does what you want, but horrible when it doesnâ€™t. There are times it removed the background but left the doll stand showing! Then when creating an ai background, when you finally find the right one (which at times can take hours), if you move your image, the background changes! Usually to a horrible one. There is a â€œlockâ€ feature in layers, but the background still changes, so the lock feature is useless. You can also save your background to â€œbrand kitâ€ but good luck finding it! You can also create a template from your design, but it saves the entire design as the background. So if you want to put a different image, it will just be on top of all the other images you used for that template instead of being able to remove it and only use the background. Finding a good ai image is the luck of the draw. You can describe what you want but sometimes itâ€™s horrible. Describe the same exact thing using a different image, and it comes out perfect! Try to get the same background for another image and you wonâ€™t be able to. I wish there was a way to save the background or actually lock it not to change so that you can use different images with the same background. As for now, that is not an available feature.
Also, sometimes when you save an image, thereâ€™s no watermark. And other times a watermark covers the entire photo multiple times, so thereâ€™s no way to use the image. So in conclusion, sometimes this app is great, sometimes itâ€™s not.

Hello. I really like the app and itâ€™s pretty easy to use. I just wanted to share some improvement and ideas. 

1. Reimbursement and refund. It would be a great feature to add a refund or reimbursement option to apply on a different account. For example if I pay with my credit card for a bill but I get refunded or reimbursed with cash. There should be an option to apply the refund into my bank account instead of original payment. 

2. When making future payments to credit accounts the bank and credit balance is adjusted automatically even before the payment date. This shows inaccurate current balances for both credit and bank. 

3. Future balance. It would be great to be able to time travel and check past or future balances of accounts. For example if I want to check what my card and bank balances will be in 3 weeks or what it was a month ago. This can help plan with budgeting for future purchases.

I canâ€™t save my role play sessions, nor can the AI analyze the whole conversation like it does with my â€œlesson planâ€ convos. I paid for the premium version so that I could get access to that type of analysis. Keep in mind I can use ChatGPT to do the same thing, so if Iâ€™m paying for a GPT wrapper I want the additional convenience to be worth it. Overall the UI is very nice and I like the main lesson plans. I just want the same summary analysis to be available on the private convos and I want to be able to save these private conversations. Look forward to seeing how this app improves.

Edit: Today I had a convo based on the challenge and was extremely confused because the answers were super complicated and didnâ€™t seem to make sense based on the setup. For example, the AI was asking me if I had advice, yet I was supposed to be a student asking the teacher questions. The AI kept answering in third person saying â€œthe teacherâ€ instead of â€œIâ€¦â€ Then, I was given two stars instead of three because I didnâ€™t give details on the grading criteria of a hypothetical assignmentâ€¦when I was the one asking the teacher about the assignment. So because the teacher didnâ€™t explain the grading criteria when I asked, Iâ€™m the one who gets a lower score? 

Looks like the prompt needs tuning.

Its role play is free to create any scenarios, and every sentences you speak will be judged by ai and give you better ideas ,up to now this function is better than Elsa speak. But Elsa is improving too , so TalkMe needs to keep up

The best app so far to help cover â€œoutputâ€ when learning a language. Itâ€™s great to speak to a person but with this there is no need to set up an appointment or be in a relationship. i wish it had furigana on the top of the kanji characters! it would make it a lot easier.
This software effectively overcame my social fears, allowing me to practice English anytime and anywhere, and improve my speaking skills.
I have greatly improved my spoken English within a year, and now I have the courage to speak English to foreigners. I will continue to use it consistently. Thank you, talkme

Iâ€™ve seen other developers try to launch AI language robots and fail so letâ€™s hope this one succeeds.  Communicating vocally and fluidly really helps stimulate authentic communicative learning. 

Original:
I thought the idea of it was so good that I paid for a subscription too quickly. Then right when I started using it, the glitches started coming out of all orifices. Iâ€™m set at native English speaker learning Japanese, but the translate button on the AIâ€™s sentences translates from Japanese into Japanese, yeah it translates nothing. lol Then I tap on a specific word in the Japanese text and it gives me the definition in Chinese hahahaha No pronunciation in English or romaji, just Chinese. Where did the Chinese come from all of the sudden? Then the feedback for my own sentence doesnâ€™t make sense. It shows incorrect and revised sentences, but they donâ€™t match up with the rationale. The revised example makes a change that isnâ€™t a correction at all, and the rationale explains a mistake that wasnâ€™t demonstrated in the revision. Iâ€™ve barely started using it and already the glitches and inconsistencies are every two seconds. Allowing companies to charge money for things that absolutely donâ€™t work at all should be a crime lol. On second thought, it probably already is â€¦. hmmmmmm

è©•è«–.æ¨™é¡Œ: Has NOTHING in common with Photoshop
è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
It keeps asking me to rate, so here I am.

Short version:
Extremely lacking compared to Photoshop; Many, downright essential tools are completely missing, the project and layer management is very obtuse and asinine, and overall the app heavily caters to mobile amateur photographers (think Instagram selfie taker) while neglecting non-standard, non-photography use cases. Overall, I think it is misleading to even have Photoshop in the name, as that implies it shares a connection to Photoshop in any way, which is not the case. 

Long Version:
Obviously compared to desktop Photoshop this app pales. Though, to start on the positive side, they have actually managed to fit a lot of features into this mobile app, especially if you are focused on quick and easy photograph editing. I think this app is meant for the Instagram selfie takers, so i'm already not in their target market. However, it is missing a LOT of very basic features when compared to desktop photoshop. I already hear your thoughts: "Of course it is lacking features compared to desktop photoshop, this is on a mobile phone!" and I understand this point, however, I would consider the features that it lacks to be extremely basic features that pretty much make this worthless for nearly anything that isn't editing Instagram selfies. I will list a few below.

Firstly, HERE ARE NO SELECTIONS AT ALL. No marquee tool, no lasso, nothing. Hidden under "Combine" > "Cutout" is a masking tool. Yes, MASKING tool. You can "Cutout" what the AI detects as objects or "Add" and "Remove". It never explicitly states what you are adding and removing, but I'll tell you, it's a layer mask. It's styled as a selection with the marching ants, but nope, layer mask. That means you can't simply select an area of your image and apply edits to the selection only, you have to duplicate your image and then apply a mask to the part you want "selected". Speaking of application, there is no marquee tool, rectangle tool, lasso tool, or free draw tool under the cutout section, there is only "Smartcut" (magic wand tool) and brush. Smartcut selection actually did pretty well in my use cases, but I don't see a reason why a marquee selection isn't an option. Smartcut already draws a rectangular selection before object detection, but whatever. The brush tool will have to do, assuming weird masking lines isn't an issue for you. I also thought that there was no way to transform your "selection"/layers, of course there's no transforming a selection, but to transform a layer you need to go out of the tool that looks like a selection and into another tool, it won't let you drag or pinch while in "Cutout". However, calling it transform is... optimistic at best, it's more like a 'move and scale' tool. You can only change the scale and position of the layer, oh, and flip it, but that's it. You are locked to the aspect ratio of the original layer, trying to change it only changes the canvas aspect ratio. Now, your natural instinct may be to crop, export, then import the cropped image into your original project, not an option here. Why not? USING CUTOUT DISABLES MOST EDIT OPTIONS. Including most image manipulation and retouching options. As well as crop. Why? Because using the cutout tool converts your project into a "mix" project rather than an "edit" project. Oh, and doing this IS DESTRUCTIVE! It doesn't save a copy before converting to a mix project, and all of your previous edits are baked in with no way of undoing the edits or conversion. In addition, most edits in this "mix" mode are destructive if you leave the editor, with the exception of cutout edits. 

Yes, completely bizarre decisions here by Adobe. I have no idea about the backend of this app so I can't necessarily say that it would be easy or hard to add the "cutout" masking in edit mode, but all project types have full layer control and the Lightroom app does this fairly well, so I can't see why not. 

If your goal is to edit a selfie, instagram beach picture, or something similar, then this app is definitely tailored for you! However, if you are expecting, or even hoping that this app is even 1% as capable as Photoshop desktop, then you will be severely disappointed. They should not have even kept the Photoshop name as it is completely misleading, this is a completely separate image retoucher and has nothing to do with "Photoshop", save for the option to send to Photoshop, which never worked for me.

Even something as simple as cutting out the middle of a screenshot was overly encumbered in Photoshop Express. I opened the app because I had a screenshot of a text message and wanted to blank and cut a portion of it out, but from the middle. Apple Photos proved difficult to even blank a portion of the image out, yet impossible to cut the middle out. With my only other option being importing the photo to my desktop for a very simple, quick, 2 minute edit, I decided to try this app for the first time. Even finding cutout was hard since all of the retouching features come up first, and I was looking for a selection tool. Anyways, you get into cutout and then you need to manually draw the area you want to cut out. Then, duplicate the image, use the brush to mask top part of the image that you want to move down, click out of the tool and drag the layer down. Oh, and if I forgot to mention it earlier, there's literally NO SNAPPING. None. Anyways, you can't crop at this point because that would give you the finished image and be too easy. Now you need to export the (uncropped) image, just import the exported image back into Express so you can get into edit mode and access the cropping tool. Why isn't there a cropping tool in mix mode? Or better yet, why can't I just rasterize and convert the project from mix to edit mode when you can the other way around? Many of the methods to do things in this app are just very asinine and donâ€™t make sense.

So I thought Iâ€™d let others know.

è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
Dear Gemini Team,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my interest in your platform and to kindly request the activation of Gemini services in Afghanistan.

As a growing community of tech-savvy individuals and cryptocurrency enthusiasts in Afghanistan, we are eager to access secure and reliable platforms like Gemini for trading and investing in digital assets. Having access to your platform would not only enhance our financial opportunities but also promote the adoption of regulated and transparent financial systems in our country.

Your commitment to providing a safe and user-friendly experience aligns with the needs of many in Afghanistan who are looking for secure cryptocurrency services. We would greatly appreciate it if you could consider enabling Gemini services in our region.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Mudasir Ziayi
Kabul, Afghanistan

I have been using this app for a while on my watch and just had to take it off. When I am relaxed and happy it will tell me to check myself and when I am upset or anxious about something it will tell me Iâ€™m in the good range. I then will get even more annoyed because as soon as I get upset my watch sends an alert to tell me Iâ€™m doing good. Itâ€™s like telling someone when they are angry to calm down.

I love this app and am a paying member for the time being. This has been helpful in training me to tune into my body and recognize what stress feels like. Iâ€™ve even started to notice high stress levels on my own a few times now which is a really big deal for me. 

Iâ€™m giving 3 stars because the data analysis is just not where it needs to be in my opinion. In the paid version you can see historical data back as far as it goes and you have the option to log how you are feeling mentally and physically at the time of a stress notification. You can also associate that notification with things like work, fitness, and alcohol and you can add your own custom ones as well. While logging these things has been helpful for personal reflection and recognition on my own, there is zero analysis of this data in the app. Here are examples of what would be useful:
-Your HRV is lower and more controlled on days you have not logged alcohol.
-Your reported feeling focused or energized more on days you have logged fitness.
- On average you log feeling tense and overwhelmed between 2-5 pm on weekdays 40% of the time. 
- or 60% of your highest stress levels last month were logged between 2-5pm on weekdays. 

I want it to recognize patterns in the data so that I can make changes to my life that prevent stress BEFORE it happens, not just while it is happening. 
For now, Iâ€™m going to keep using the app to continue building my skills in recognizing my own body sensations. But after another month or so I will likely cancel my subscription because $13 a month or $40 per year is too expensive just to be able to log how you are feeling and view historical data that has no helpful analysis or pattern recognition.
Free bits are not very helpful and paid portion is too expensive.

I initially downloaded this app to help manage my severe anxiety attacks after being hospitalized a few months ago. I was hoping it would provide insights into my episodes since I hadnâ€™t experienced much anxiety before my hospitalization. Despite the high ratings, my experience was disappointing. I used the free version for some time but kept running into glitches, so I was desperate enough to try the free trial. Unfortunately, it was to no avail. The data was hours behind, alerts didnâ€™t come in real time, and it glitched frequently with my watch. After the trial was over, it glitched even more. I tried to fix and repair it, but nothing worked, and deleted the app from my watch and phone. 

I requested a refund after a day of trying, but it was unsuccessful. The most frustrating part was the lack of customer support. Despite reaching out multiple times, I received no assistance or satisfactory explanations for the issues I encountered. This was an expensive mistake, and I hope my review helps others avoid a similar error in judgment.
I never write reviews, but I felt compelled to warn others before purchasing this product. While it wasnâ€™t the most expensive app, having something that doesnâ€™t work as it should shouldnâ€™t be the customerâ€™s burden. Despite the high star rating, consider this app a fraud, even more so after my experience. As a few other people like me have had the same issue, I hope this review helps others avoid a similar mistake.

è©•è«–.æ¨™é¡Œ: Really good but not entirely reliable
è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
This is the premium AI platform that I have used (others tried Copilot Pro, ChatGPT Plus, Perplexity Pro, and Grok on X thus far, and various models on Poe) that is the most advanced in terms of feature set and utility. Thereâ€™s a lot that it can (sometimes try to) do. Real-time Internet search capability and ability to ingest private data directly is where this bot platform really excels. As my previous sentence alluded to, however, it also has been the most unreliable in terms of availability.

I frequently get issues where a chat prompt or multi step task fails to complete or times out. Sometimes errors are returned that are API related. Sometimes the app is waiting for a response forever as there doesnâ€™t seem to be a local timeout to make the prompt error out after a long time of waiting for a response. It just spins or shows a loading animation of some sort forever. Iâ€™ve seen this behavior across their other apps like for desktop and in a web browser so I donâ€™t believe the issues I am seeing are localized to the iOS app. During the times Monica doesnâ€™t respond or errors out, the other third party AI services I mentioned previously all work fine so I know I donâ€™t have a general Internet connectivity issue. This is across multiple Internet connections as well including cellular. Sometimes connecting to a distant VPN server can fix the issue which I am guessing implicates that there is geographical load balancing going on where an issue for one region doesnâ€™t impact the other because they are in separate geographical regions.

If the Monica team can fix these sporadic system or connectivity failures to make the platform more stable across various Monica user interfaces, then my review would be all 5 stars.

è©•è«–.æ¨™é¡Œ: DANGEROUS APP - SEVERE PRIVACY AND SECURITY RISK
è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
I'm writing this as both a user and an app developer to warn others. This app is likely part of an organized international scam operation. Here's what happened to me:
I had TanTan installed for about a month. While I received messages from multiple supposed female users, they all seemed suspicious, and I never responded. The real issue emerged when I discovered the app was tracking my location in 'Always' mode without my conscious consent.
Yesterday, while driving on Highway 1 in San Francisco, I received an SMS claiming to be about toll charges. The link looked legitimate, but it was actually a phishing scam from a Philippines number (+63). Within minutes of entering my card details, I had to freeze my card.
After investigating how scammers knew my exact location, I found that TanTan was the only app set to 'Always' share my location. This level of location tracking was likely used to enable targeted scams.
The app appears to be of Chinese origin and shows clear signs of being part of a sophisticated fraud operation. It's not just a dating app - it's a security threat that can compromise your location data and financial information.
DO NOT INSTALL THIS APP. If you have it installed, remove it immediately and check your location sharing settings. Your privacy and financial security are at risk.

If you donâ€™t want to read my detail explanation, save your money on the dating side of the app, but the social media live-streaming site is OK.  

Iâ€™ve sent over 500 messages to people who supposedly liked my profile, but Iâ€™ve only received two repliesâ€”one of which was just a GIF. Some of these profiles show they havenâ€™t been online in over a year, yet somehow they â€œlikedâ€ me recently, which feels suspicious. 

Thereâ€™s also a live-streaming feature on the app, which is a nice addition. Iâ€™ve made friends with one woman through her stream, and we even shared WeChat, which was surprising. I also connected with two guys during a live streamâ€”they seem cool. But ultimately, this is supposed to be a dating app, not just a place to make friends.

I purchased a three-month subscription for about $15, expecting better results. However, I later realized that sending more â€œsuper crushesâ€ or unlocking additional features costs $10 a month extraâ€”meaning I ended up paying $30 for three months. Even then, I discovered thereâ€™s a more expensive tier, costing $800 a year, just to message the most popular profiles. Thatâ€™s an entirely separate cost on top of changing search settings or sending more crushes.

The pricing structure feels misleading because itâ€™s not clear what each subscription level includes. On top of that, many profiles seem fake or inactive, yet theyâ€™re still liking profiles to generate activity. I used this app seven years ago when it was simpler, but itâ€™s definitely shifted toward being more of a social platform than a dating app. I wish Iâ€™d done more research before subscribing. Itâ€™s not just the high priceâ€”itâ€™s the confusing benefits and questionable profiles that make me feel like Iâ€™ve been scammed.

Videoleap used to be my go-to all in one application of choice for years and I never expected to drop my ratings, but here we are. The prioritization of AI integration appears to have come at the loss of some very basic features. The one that is most inconvenient is that itâ€™s no longer integrated with giphy for stickers. Well you donâ€™t use stickers for advanced video editing, there is a time in a place for them such as making a tutorial video and wanting a quick circle around a highlighted button. But itâ€™s gone. Today I wanted to create a short animation referencing that this is fine meme where again, fire stickers would have been ideal. Instead, I had to choose an overlay with less than ideal fire video. But it has a black background and the chroma feature to remove it is gone/ replaced by their new button â€œremove backgroundâ€ but that button apparently is not an option to use for the fire overlay. So essentially my entire video is covered up by the stupid black video with red flames. Most people who use video editing phone apps are newbs and they will rely even more on stickers. But no, its gone.

Videoleap also got rid of their integration with their other software. Previously there was a link to quickly open a photoleap (adjacent editing software). Itâ€™s gone. 

Iâ€™m just not sure why they drop features that are clearly helpful. They did the same thing with their OG editing app, ENLIGHT, which I still keep on my iPhone despite the lack of updates because it has features that were never carried over into subsequent releases after they changed the pay model from one time purchase to subscription-based.

It was worth it, but I quickly learned that highly edited videos over 8 minutes are extremely unoptimized and need to be put together in separated segments so the entire editing program isnâ€™t horrendously laggy and difficult to work with. I continued using it until the awful addition of a TikTok / Instagram Reels / YouTube shorts type thing was implemented, which I absolutely never used. My discontent with the editor I loved started to grow. It got worse when the program started to use AI generated voices and images, something Iâ€™m highly against due to being an artist. Pretty awful for artists and editors alike, not to mention a huge breach of security.

Whenever you need translation during your travels, business trips or while studying a language just bring Papago, a smart parrot who can translate multiple languages for you.

â–¶Â What does â€˜Papagoâ€™ mean? 
In Esperanto, Papago refers to a parrot, a bird with language abilities. 
Papago supports 14 languages : Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese (Simplified/Traditional), Spanish, French, Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian, Russian, German, Italian and Arabic. 

â–¶ Main features
1) Text Translation
Real-time text translation for phrases and words

2) Image Translation
Automatic recognition and translation of text in the image by taking a picture and pressing the button 

3) Voice Translation
Real-time voice translation to both text and audio

4) Offline translation
Can translate even in offline

5) Conversation Translation 
Simultaneously speak in each otherâ€™s language when talking one-on-one with a foreigner

6) Handwriting Translation
Handwriting translation that finds the correct word and translation when you write using your finger

7) Website Translation 
Automatic translation for all content when you include the URL of a foreign website

8) Edu
Taking a picture of the passage you want to study will create a 
My Note that you can use to study passages and words

9) Dictionary
Dictionary information provided to check additional meanings other than initial translation results

Be confident anytime, anywhere with your translating partner Papago!

è©•è«–.æ¨™é¡Œ: Best note-taking app for college students!
è©•è«–.å…§å®¹: I did a lot of research on which app would be the best to take notes for my classes on my ipad. As a Pre-Med student, all of the classes I have to take I have to retain the information for Med school. This app is the most organized note taking app I tried (Free form, good notes, apple journals, etc.) Having all of my class notes in one spot and not collecting a thick heavy spiral every semester is so nice and convenient. You can download your lecture slides as a pdf and then share it to add it to your notes in Notability to then annotate directly on the slides or pdf your prof. gave you. You do have to get the annual subscription for the total benefits, but i think $15-18 ish dollars once a year is completely worth it, plus Notability has the cheapest subscription plan I could find. I recommend this app to everyone who wants to be able to make clean and neat notes with straight lines, perfect shapes (LOVED this feature for organic chemistry), and unlimited colors, writing utensils, and thickness of the ink. The best new feature has helped me a lot, where they use AI and take your notes you have written (or imported as a pdf or slides) and you can summarize all of your notes, and even make AI generated practice questions and quizzes! This helped me a lot with cramming for finals teehee. There are a lot of customization options in every aspect of your notes (page color, line sizes, lines, graph paper, music staff paper, color ink, ink thickness, crayon, sticky notes, highlighter, etc) Anyways, excuse the essay, but I highly recommend this app to someone wanting to switch to electronic notes!!!ğŸ¤ğŸ«¶ğŸ»

Notability is one of the most frustrating apps Iâ€™ve ever used. At first, I was excitedâ€”it seemed like the perfect tool for organizing my notes and staying on top of my work. But after just a few hours of use, it stopped me in my tracks.

I was in the middle of taking notes during an important lecture when the app suddenly switched to read-only mode. Imagine this: Iâ€™m frantically trying to keep up with the professor, writing down key points, and thenâ€”bam!â€”the app refuses to let me type or annotate anything. Instead, I was left staring at my half-finished notes, completely helpless.

At first, I thought it was a glitch, but no. Apparently, Iâ€™d hit some kind of usage limit after only a few hours, and the app locked me out of editing unless I subscribed to their premium plan. There was no warning, no grace period, and no way to continue taking notes without paying up.

This threw my entire week into chaos. I missed out on notes for multiple classes while scrambling to find an alternative app. I felt blindsided and frustratedâ€”if Iâ€™d known this would happen, I never would have relied on Notability in the first place.

If youâ€™re considering downloading Notability, be warned: the free version is basically a trap. It lures you in, gets you comfortable, and then blocks you from using key features unless you fork over money. Save yourself the stress and find an app that doesnâ€™t pull stunts like this.

è©•è«–.æ¨™é¡Œ: Feels like an Old school gacha
è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
This game feels like a relic, even though it launched in 2017, but I dig those vibes. 

The game is very generous towards new players and has lots of systems that are fun to interact with. Are they systems designed to drain you of your cash? Yes, but at least they did a good job designing it. 

However itâ€™s not the best experience. The story is ok, I personally have been having difficulty connecting with it; probably because of how itâ€™s presented, very static cutscenes in between battles which arenâ€™t super engaging to begin with.

In that note, yes strategy is involved in setting up your units, you can get very technical about it, but after that you just watch them, combat is automatic and you get no input, itâ€™s not very dynamic.

It does have the benefit of being an older game, which means thereâ€™s lots to do, but most of it you have to slog through.

Maybe if this game out in 2010 I wouldnâ€™t be so harsh on it, but even when this game came out there were better mobile games out there, and there still are.

Fortunately they have a sequel thatâ€™s pretty good, even if it does crash a lot. You donâ€™t need to play this to play that, go try Brown Dust 2.

I am a birth worker who offers complimentary birth photography to my clients. I decided to use VSCO to edit photos for a client and signed up for their 7-day trial to use Pro. After the trial, I paid for a one-year subscription.

After you select the ones you want to change, there will be a button saying to install all icons or something, you will know it when you see it. DO NOT PRESS THIS BUTTON!!! It will make you pay for it. And if you press the two buttons at the top of the screen, it will just save the backround photos to your camera roll. Only download this app if it is worthit. Not just a Transcriber

Turn your voice into text! Just speak into your phone, and voilaâ€”we'll convert your words into a handy transcription. But there is more.

What's in it for you?

ACCURATE TRANSCRIPTION
- Check out the written version of what you saidâ€”every little detail captured!

AI PROCESSED NOTE
- Let our AI organize your words into a neat and tidy noteâ€”clean up that messy text.

LIST OF IMPORTANT POINTS
- Get a list of the important stuff from your talkâ€”no need to sift through a bunch of words.

SUMMARIZED VERSION
- We'll also whip up a short and sweet summary of what you saidâ€”so you can get the gist without all the gab.

5 Ways Our App Simplifies Your Life

MEETING MASTERY:
- Record your brainstorming sessions or team meetings effortlessly.
- Easily review the key points and decisions through the structured note and important points list.
- Share a quick summary with your team for a productive follow-up.

STUDY AID:
- Turn your class lectures into well-organized notes for better understanding.
- Quickly grasp the essential points from your lessons with the important points list.
- Create concise summaries to reinforce your learning.

IDEA JOURNAL:
- Capture your creative sparks on the go by speaking your thoughts into the app.
- Transform your ideas into a formatted note and extract key concepts effortlessly.
- Summarize your brilliant brainwaves for quick recall and inspiration.

INTERVIEW INSIGHTS:
- Record job interviews or important conversations for reference.
- Use the AI-processed note to review the discussion in a structured manner.
- Generate a summarized version to highlight crucial moments and decisions.

PODCAST PERFECTION:
- Record podcast episodes and let the app create transcriptions for easy content creation.
- Utilize the important points list to identify key topics and highlights.
- Share concise summaries on social media to engage your audience and spark interest.

It's like magic, but with words! Give it a go and see your ideas come to life.

I downloaded Transcribe AI during a promotion. Until now my experience with transcription apps had been less than stellar. Transcribe AI exceeded all my expectations and then some. After using it for several days, I only found a single error; and that was almost certainly due to a mispronunciation by the speaker. The accuracy is almost eerie. 
 I was surprised, and then astonished, to find the transcriptions are not word-for-word. (It would not be useful for preserving an exact courtroom transcript for example.) Instead the app, seemingly through wizardry, edits away repetition and the stuttering and stammering inherent in normal speech. The result is a concise summary of the significant points addressed by the speaker without the excess verbiage. It is the perfect note taking device. Transcribe AI will even turn the copy into precise bullet points with a tap of the screen. The app would have relieved me of hours of editing notes every week when I attended college.

è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
Ok I'm altering my review slightly.

My positive review for the app remains the same (see below). But they're not editing the advertising very well. And there's a lot of extremely violent and sexual advertising. It is built into the game. 

There's a little wrapped present sitting on the main screen. You can can click on, to watch a video, leading more points. Those videos have a lot of Arnold Schwarzenegger style violence and very sexualized women barely dressed, mostly in underclothes and bikinis. 

I've had to stop my girls from playing. Which is too bad because it's such a cute app. 

My original app review: 

"My kindergarten and second grader love this. Cute, age appropriate and self-explanatory.

Moving around the room is a bit awkward, and takes a little bit of getting used to. 

But thats a fairly minor complaint. 

I'm giving it five stars because are really enjoying it. I would highly recommend it for someone who's got kindergarten or older kids who's looking for for non-violent or explicit game." 

I'm no longer recommend this for young kids, solely because of the advertising.

Ojipockle is a very cute game full of charm. I recommend this game to everyone of all ages. The quirky lightheartedness reminds me of Katamari Damacy like how there are little tiny men in a large bedroom and the quirkiness of the whole idea is just cute and funny. I love the cute chubby Ojipockle and their descriptions. 

It's a really great relaxing game! I also appreciate that this game can be played 100% offline which is awesome! Also there is "My Ojipockle" which looks like an expansion of this game where you can raise a baby Ojipockle and decorate its room and explore more areas of the house like bathroom and kitchen etc. and play mini-games! Both games from this developer is great!

è©•è«–.æ¨™é¡Œ: Gorgeous game, leaves more depth to be desired
è©•è«–.å…§å®¹:
This is a beautiful, well designed game that's ideal for killing time. Contrary to the complaints of other reviewers, I don't think the controls are too cumbersome. You are a Japanese university student named Sara(???) who is tasked to assault the adorable "Ojipockles" (old man fairies) who occupy her small flat with  bottle of "fairy water", whereupon they will burst into hearts, which eventually allow you to level up and assault more Ojipockles in different outfits. Yeah, I don't get it either. 

This game is super addicting but I wish there were slightly more plot development here. Because the prologue was handled so beautifully, I had really been looking forward to more cutscenes with dialogue or something. After getting to level 13 of 36, I'm starting to feel like there's aren't many incentives to look forward to beyond viewing new Oji designs. The gameplay is also so simple that I'd actually like it if it more challenges were thrown at me. There's really no way to "lose," or even be set back a little. No enemies, no time limits, no chasing.

All that said, this is still pretty incredible for a free mobile game. The concept is fun, entertaining and it's visually pleasing.
MY FAVORITE GAME

Though Iâ€™m in my 40s, Iâ€™m very tech savvy. Iâ€™m the one who fixes my familyâ€™s phones, etc, & I run a side business on my phone, including the contact info of 100s of clients.

In an effort to clear some storage space on my phone, I researched various cleaning apps to find the best one for my needs. This included looking at a number of reviews from 3rd party sources. I decided to try this app. I encountered the following problems:
1- No instructions were given about how to use the app & how it would affect your phone.
2- I asked it to merge repeated contacts. Weeks later, I am still finding contacts it erased entirely!!!
3- I asked it to delete duplicate photos, NOT similar photos. It decided 3 pictures I took at a friendâ€™s wedding were too similar & deleted them all! Luckily I know how to retrieve them. Otherwise I wouldnâ€™t have any of those pictures.
4- It erased my personal contact information despite there being only one entry in my contacts. I had to completely reset Siri because she didnâ€™t know my home address or who my relatives were. 
5- The app erased my map settings. I use my GPS almost every day for work. Not because I donâ€™t know where I am going, but to get from place to place efficiently. Itâ€™s hard for me to ask for directions to my home and other places Iâ€™ve marked when they no longer exist for the program to access.

In summary, I wouldnâ€™t trust this app to help you in any way. All it did was cause me trouble. Of course, I deleted it, but I wonder how long Iâ€™m going to be fixing the things it screwed up. Hopefully this review will act as a warning for the next consumer & save them time & worry.

Like others, I simply wanted to download a Cooking Mama game to cook recipes. I was subsequently barraged by an overwhelming assortment of pop-ups and immediately closed the game. Too much! Then, a couple days later, I opened it again. 30 is not an advanced age, but it's enough to feel the difference between Cooking Mama as I knew it, and Cooking Mama as it is now. 

To those who are seeking the classic Cooking Mama experience: it is here! Simply ignore everything but the Kitchen, and you will be happy. 

To those looking for more idle game opportunities, and other aging Millennials: recall those activity center CD-roms, or Flash game websites. The rest of this app recalls those times. The Happy Village contains a fishing mini-game; the Challenge area contains many more mini-games; you can decorate your finished recipes with stickers, etc.

I've been enjoying my time with Cooking Mama. With no money spent, you'll get about 1:30-2:00 of daily content with this game, and most of that is idle time. Desk workers will enjoy it. 
Give it a try!
Itâ€™s nice but the only thing i don't like is all the popups ğŸ˜Š

I seriously just wanted a simple, cute cooking game. 

Instead I am trying to figure out 20+ different things a day. 

Not only recipes, as expected . . .
But then a restaurant. Like, okay? Sure, I guess. 

But then, also, a farm. 
And a garden. 

And all these other things, too?!?! 

Itâ€™s too much!!!

I canâ€™t even check off my tasks and then actually â€œmake recipesâ€, because thereâ€™s so much going on! 

If this was set up more like Animal Crossing:Pocket Camp, so there were still tasks, but quicker and easier to get through, then okay. 

Instead, I feel like I am just running around in circles while simultaneously being led a hundred different directions.
I love cooking mama! Though to adds and pop ups and the little things telling me what to do is overstimulating. I love the bringing back of Cooking mama though! I think I should stick to the Wii.

Unleash Your Musical Talent with Smule - The Original Karaoke App! Sing over 10 million of your favorite songs with music and scrolling lyrics. Enjoy karaoke for free anytime, anywhere! Join Smuleâ€™s global music community, where you can record solos, duets, and group performancesâ€”with or without video. Elevate your singing with professional voice effects, share your creations with millions worldwide, and build a fanbase of listeners who love your unique sound. Whether youâ€™re just starting out or an experienced singer, Smule gives you the platform to connect with fans, grow your audience, and take your performances to the next level.

FEATURES:
â€¢  Sing Anytime, Anywhere: Access over 10 million karaoke songs with scrolling lyrics. Enjoy a massive catalog of songs across genres like pop, rock, R&B, country, K-pop, and more.
â€¢  Record & Share: Capture your singing in solo, duet, or group performances, and share your creations with the Smule community.
â€¢  Duet with Top Artists: Sing alongside popular artists like Ed Sheeran, Dua Lipa, Olivia Rodrigo, Disney characters, and more! Smule lets you perform duets with recordings of top names in music, making you feel like a star.
â€¢  Professional Vocal Recording: Use professional-grade vocal recording tools with special voice effects, reverb and voice tune to enhance your recordings.
â€¢  Music Video Creator: Create music videos with a karaoke mixer and add vocal effects that elevate your performances to professional levels.
â€¢  Live Global Performances: Go live and shine! Host or join live karaoke parties with the Sing Live feature, giving real-time performances 24/7 with friends and music lovers worldwide. Share your talent live, gain fans, receive feedback, and perform for an interactive audience.
â€¢  Learn and Improve: Access vocal lessons, practice with our pitch guide, and track your progress over time to perfect your voice and be a better singer!
â€¢  Join Exciting Challenges: Participate in regular karaoke contests and events to showcase your talent and win rewards.
â€¢  Create and Customize: Transform your voice with professional-grade effects like reverb, AI powered tools and more. Use our music studio features to mix and edit your recordings, add video filters, and create captivating music videos.

Download Smule today and start singing! Whether youâ€™re a seasoned vocalist or just love to sing for fun, Smule has something for everyone. Explore our vast music library, create and share your own music, and connect with a community that shares your passion.

Smule makes it easy to express yourself, connect with others, and take your music to the next level. Sing your heart out, discover new music, and join a global community of millions of singers, creators, and music fans.

SUBSCRIPTION OPTIONS
- Subscribe for unlimited access to our full karaoke song catalog and sing karaoke solos, duets, group songs and a cappella for the duration of your subscription
- Subscriptions are weekly, monthly and annual*
- Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase
- Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period
- Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period
- Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings
- No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during active subscription period
- Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription
- You can read our privacy policy at www.smule.com/privacy
*Price are equal to the value that "Apple's App Store Matrix" determines is the equivalent of the subscription price in $USD
https://www.smule.com/termsofservice

âšªï¸ Conclusion:

â– â– â–  How to Play â– â– â– 
1. Click on the screen to control the ballâ€™s launch the moment.
2. Match three or more balls of the same color on the track.
3. The balls on the track canâ€™t fall into the hole, otherwise the game is over.
4. When all the balls on the track are matched, the level passes.

â– â– â–  Game Feature â– â– â– 
1. Scene with Theme: Four Seasons Island (spring, summer, autumn and winter). There are several levels in each season island; each level corresponds to the different theme of the corresponding season.
2. Difficulty Level: Easy mode, Normal mode and Hard mode. Whether you are a beginner or an advanced player, you can find difficulty level for your challenge.
3. Maps and Tracks: More than 70 carefully designed level Maps and Tracks.
4. Special Balls: More than 10 special balls that have special effects. They make this game more gameplay and fun.
5. Music and Sound: Multiple sets of background music and various sound effects to match different scenes with themes.
